titles.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives with regard to community renewal through community- and faith-based organizations.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
Mr. Souder moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 207.
DEBATE - Mr. Scott asked unanimous consent that debate on the resolution be extended by 10 minutes. Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/15/1999--Introduced. Declares that the House of Representatives should work: (1) to empower community- and faith-based organizations to promote effective long-term solutions to the social, financial, and emotional needs of urban centers and rural communities; and (2) with the Senate and the President to support a compassionate grassroots approach to addressing the family, economic, and cultural breakdown in such communities.
